metadata.Description: Biomass refers to organic matter, such as plants or plant-based materials, that can be used as a renewable energy source.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
A concept that aims to ensure a fair and equitable transition to a sustainable energy system, taking into account social, economic, and environmental aspects.
Biomass refers to organic matter, such as plants or plant-based materials, that can be used as a renewable energy source.
Renewable energy generated from sources located in bodies of water, such as wind farms or tidal power plants.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.
Energy and modernization refers to the process of integrating modern energy systems and technologies into various sectors of society.

relations.Description: Biomass implements energy generation methods that utilize organic materials to produce heat, electricity, or biofuels.

relations.Description: Biomass plays a role in the energy transition by providing a renewable alternative to fossil fuels for heat and electricity generation.

relations.Description: Biomass partners with the agricultural sector to obtain organic materials for biomass energy production.
relations.Subject: biomass

relations.Description: Biomass contributes to climate change mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions through the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Description: Biomass monitors energy efficiency in biomass energy production processes to optimize resource utilization and minimize waste.

energy and modernization
relations.Description: Energy and modernization implements rigorous building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: energy and modernization
relations.Description: Energy and modernization funds renewable energy projects to support the transition to clean and sustainable energy sources.

relations.Subject: offshore renewable energy
relations.Description: Offshore renewable energy implements building standards that promote the use of sustainable energy sources and technologies.

relations.Subject: offshore renewable energy
relations.Description: Offshore renewable energy funds research and development projects to advance the use of sustainable energy technologies.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition supports energy equity by promoting equal access to clean and affordable energy.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency collaborates with industries to develop and implement energy-saving measures and technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

Wood biomass refers to the use of wood and wood products as a source of energy. It can be derived from forest residues, logging residues, and wood processing waste. Wood biomass is a renewable and carbon-neutral source of energy.
relations.Subject: wood biomass

relations.Description: Agricultural biomass includes crop residues, such as stalks, husks, and straw, as well as dedicated energy crops grown specifically for energy production. It is a sustainable source of energy that can reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote rural development.
relations.Subject: agricultural biomass

relations.Description: Animal biomass refers to the use of animal waste, such as manure and carcasses, as a source of energy. It can be converted into biogas through anaerobic digestion, providing a renewable and environmentally friendly energy option.
relations.Subject: animal biomass

relations.Description: Aquatic biomass includes algae and aquatic plants that can be used as a source of energy. It can be converted into biofuels, such as biodiesel and bioethanol, through various processes. Aquatic biomass has the potential to provide a sustainable and carbon-neutral energy solution.
relations.Subject: aquatic biomass

relations.Description: Municipal solid waste biomass refers to the use of organic waste from households and businesses as a source of energy. It can be converted into biogas or used for the production of heat and electricity through incineration. Utilizing municipal solid waste biomass can help reduce landfill waste and promote a circular economy.
relations.Subject: municipal solid waste biomass
